title: E field of distribution - semicirc - point charge

content.description: Point <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> is located at the center of a circle, which is represented by the dashed line in the figure. Along the top half of the circle is a thin, semicircular ring made of an insulating material containing a uniformly distributed positive charge <math alttext="positive Q" overflow="scroll"> <mo>+</mo> <mi>Q</mi> </math>. A point charge of the same total charge <math alttext="positive Q" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></math> is located at the bottommost point on the circle.
content.question: Which of the following correctly indicated the direction, if any, of the electric field <math alttext="vector E sub C" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mover accent="true"> <mi>E</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> <mtext>C</mtext> </msub> </math> at Point <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="vector E sub C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> is zero and has no direction. The semicircle has equal amounts of charge in the left half and the right half.

<math alttext="vector E sub C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> is zero and has no direction. There are equal amounts of charge above and below Point <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, all at the same distance from Point <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>.

<math alttext="vector E sub C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> is directed toward the top of the figure. The electric field due to the ring is zero at Point <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, so only the point charge contributes to the field.

<math alttext="vector E sub C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> is nonzero and directed toward the top of the figure. The electric field at Point <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> due to the ring is nonzero but less than that due to the point charge.

content.answer: <math alttext="vector E sub C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> is nonzero and directed toward the top of the figure. The electric field at Point <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> due to the ring is nonzero but less than that due to the point charge.
